rejected.description: Ten Years Without the Aosta–Pré-Saint-Didier Railway — Aosta Sera & Media Perspectives A Decade Since the Last Train December 2025 marks ten years since the last train ran on the Aosta–Pré-Saint-Didier railway, a historic line that linked Aosta — the heart of the Valle d’Aosta — with Pré-Saint-Didier and the high Valdigne. What was initially presented … Continue reading "Ten Years Without the Aosta–Pré-Saint-Didier Railway — What Aosta Sera, Gazzetta Matin and Local Voices Are Saying" The post T
rejected.content: Ten Years Without the Aosta–Pré-Saint-Didier Railway — Aosta Sera & Media Perspectives A Decade Since the Last Train December 2025 marks ten years since the last train ran on the Aosta–Pré-Saint-Didier railway , a historic line that linked Aosta — the heart of the Valle d’Aosta — with Pré-Saint-Didier and the high Valdigne. What was initially presented as a temporary suspension has since become a long-standing transport, tourism and regional mobility issue. Aostasera The Aosta–Pré-Saint-Didier line was opened in 1929 and closed at the end of 2015. Wikipedia What Aosta Sera Reports According to Aosta Sera , the closure — on 24 December 2015 — completed 10 years of interruption just before Christmas, highlighting how a once-active service has now become a symbol of stalled infrastructure in the region. Aostasera Aosta Sera emphasizes several key perspectives: Historic Memories: Locals, including former railway worker Livio Soldà, recall when the line offered multiple daily and even long-
